main event: On May 3, 1964, witnesses observed two unidentified luminous objects near Canberra, Australia, with one object appearing to collide with the other.
interesting points: The first object moved in a wobbly path, got brighter as it traveled, and was larger and brighter than a star., The second object appeared to be stationary with a pinkish-orange glow., There was no noise associated with either object., The objects demonstrated unusual motion unlike known satellites, including a dramatic change in speed upon collision., The sighting was reported to the American Embassy and investigated by officials from NASA and the U.S. State Department.
witness description: Mr. _, his wife, and a friend at a tourist camp
